page.title: 12FEATURES OF S.DOWNS
page.content: The view from the top of the Downs is restricted by trees, particularly on the S.side where there used to be a clear view of the Trundle at Goodwood & of the sea at Chichester harbour. Northward, there are still wide views over Graffham, Ambersham, Heyshott & to Blackdown hill at Haslemere. There are only three dwellings in this block: Broadham House, nr.Single- ton (sq.9), Newhouse Farm & Pheasant House nr. E.Dean (sq.11). Most farmland is divided by post & wire fences but a few fields have traditional hedges. Gates are of metal or wood. Wooden fences divide the forests on the S.edge of the downs with stiles for access to paths which are finger posted on the top of the downs but not in the forest where over grown paths are hard to follow. The S.Downs Way is clearly finger posted.
